name: Alfred Pennyworth (Gough)
description: The loyal and stalwart butler of Bruce Wayne, serving both as caretaker and confidant.

content.title: Background
content.body: Alfred Pennyworth (as portrayed by Michael Gough) is an English butler for the Wayne family. He has been serving the Wayne household since Bruce Wayne was a child and has remained in his service, acting as a surrogate father figure after the murder of Bruce's parents.

content.title: Personality
content.body: Alfred Pennyworth is depicted as deeply loyal, caring, and wise. He is often concerned about Bruce's safety and well-being but remains supportive of Bruce's campaign as Batman. Alfred is known for his dry wit and often provides sage advice to Bruce in times of crisis.

content.title: Story Role
content.body: In the Burton Batman films, Alfred serves as Bruce Wayne's trustworthy butler, confidant, and an essential support figure in his life as Batman. His guidance and unwavering support are crucial for Bruce's dual life. Alfred often provides moral and emotional support to Batman, stitching wounds and reminding him of his humanity and legacy.

content.title: Relationships
content.body:
- **Bruce Wayne (Burton)**: Acts as a surrogate father and loyal confidant.
- **Vicki Vale**: Initially skeptical of her, but becomes supportive, understanding she means well for Bruce.

content.title: Abilities
content.body: Alfred Pennyworth possesses excellent skills in housekeeping and etiquette. He is also knowledgeable about first aid and has rudimentary knowledge in mechanics, electronics, and security systems.
